CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 11, 1955, pg. 5, reads: "Fire Fans Faith - The disastrous church fire on May 16 (right photo) which started when a nine-year-old firebug lit a flame under the church's pulpit to cause almost complete destruction (center photo) has fanned the faith of most of the residents in Dornestic Street section of North Side's Perrysville sector who say that they will rebuild a larger church if it means becoming 'country builders' like their forefathers who built the first mission. Their determination is strengthened by youngsters, some shown in the second photo, who long for 'their Sunday school.'  The North Side Federated Mission was forty years old at the time of the fire... -Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women, men, and children standing in front of burned North Side Federated Mission church building, Dornestic Street, Perrysville
